children.name: Image tagging
description: Annotate an image of some sort, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

children.name: Image Captioning
description: Image captioning is the automatic generation of natural language descriptions of the content of an input image.

children.name: Image Paragraph Captioning
description: Automatic generation of detailed, multi-sentence natural language descriptions of the content of an input image.

children.name: Phrase Grounding
description: Assigning each entity mentioned in a given caption of an image to a corresponding location in the respective image.

children.name: Flickr30k Entities Test - Phrase Grounding benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Flickr30k Entities Test - Phrase Grounding benchmarking

children.name: Flickr30k Entities Dev - Phrase Grounding benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Flickr30k Entities Dev - Phrase Grounding benchmarking

children.name: Meme Captioning
description: Automatic generation of natural language descriptions of the content of an input meme.

children.name: Flickr30k Captions test - Image Captioning benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Flickr30k Captions test - Image Captioning benchmarking

children.name: COCO Captions test - Image Captioning benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: COCO Captions test - Image Captioning benchmarking

children.name: Meme Classification
description: Meme classification refers to the task of classifying internet memes.

children.name: Chinese Language Processing
description: Chinese language processing is the task of applying natural language processing to the Chinese language.

children.name: Handwritten Chinese Character Recognition
description: Handwritten Chinese characters recognition is the task of detecting and interpreting the components of Chinese characters (i.e. radicals and two-dimensional structures).

children.name: Handwritten Chinese Text Recognition
description: Handwritten Chinese text recognition is the task of interpreting handwritten Chinese input, e.g., from images of documents or scans.

children.name: Chinese Word Segmentation
description: Chinese word segmentation is the task of splitting Chinese text (i.e. a sequence of Chinese characters) into words (Source: www.nlpprogress.com).

children.name: MSR - Chinese Word Segmentation benchmarking
description: Splitting a sequence of simplified Chinese characters (i.e., characters that are less complicated and have less strokes) into words.

children.name: AS - Chinese Word Segmentation benchmarking
description: Splitting a sequence of traditional Chinese characters (i.e., characters that are more complicated and have more strokes) into words.

children.name: PKU - Chinese Word Segmentation benchmarking
description: Splitting a sequence of simplified Chinese characters (i.e., characters that are less complicated and have less strokes) into words.

children.name: MSRA - Chinese Word Segmentation benchmarking
description: Splitting a sequence of simplified Chinese characters (i.e., characters that are less complicated and have less strokes) into words.

children.name: CITYU - Chinese Word Segmentation benchmarking
description: Splitting a sequence of traditional Chinese characters (i.e., characters that are more complicated and have more strokes) into words.

children.name: Chinese Zero Pronoun Resolution
description: Chinese zero pronoun resolution refers to the task of resolving a so-called zero segment of a Chinese text that is not written but supplies information for interpreting the text.

children.name: Dialog process
description: Dialog process refers to tasks that have the text type 'dialog' as input and / or output.
refactor_comment: Class cannot be assigned to 'Natural language analysis' or 'Natural language generation' since it covers subclasses of both categories.

children.name: Dialog Generation
description: Given an input dialog statement, generate an appropriate response.

children.name: Dialog State Tracking
description: Determining at each turn of a dialog the full representation of what the user wants at that point in the dialog, which contains a goal constraint, a set of requested slots, and the user's dialogue act (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Second dialogue state tracking challenge - Dialog State Tracking benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Second dialogue state tracking challenge - Dialog State Tracking benchmarking

papers_with_code_id: Visual Dialog v1.0 - Visual Dialog benchmarking

children.name: VisDial v0.9 val - Visual Dialog benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: VisDial v0.9 val - Visual Dialog benchmarking

children.name: Task-Oriented Dialog Systems
description: Achieving a pre-defined task through a dialog.

children.name: Goal-Oriented Dialog
description: Achieving a pre-defined goal through a dialog.

children.name: Short-Text Conversation
description: Given a short text, finding an appropriate response (Source: http://staff.ustc.edu.cn/~cheneh/paper_pdf/2013/HaoWang.pdf)

children.name: Goal-Oriented Dialog Systems
description: Achieving a pre-defined goal through a dialog.

children.name: Dialog Interpretation
description: Interpreting the meaning of a dialog.

children.name: Dialog Act Classification
description: Classifying an utterance with respect to the function it serves in a dialog, i.e. the act the speaker is performing (Source nlpprogress.com).

children.name: ICSI Meeting Recorder Dialog Act (MRDA) corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking

children.name: Switchboard corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Switchboard corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking

children.name: Natural language generation
description: Generating natural language based on internal machine representations.

children.name: Machine Translation
description: Translate text or speech from one language to another.

children.name: Word Alignment
description: Identifying translation relationships among words or multiple words in a bitext.

children.name: Transliteration
description: Converting a text from one script to another that involves swapping letters in predictable ways (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Unsupervised Machine Translation
description: Translate text or speech from one language to another without translation resources for training.

children.name: Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation
description: Translating from one language to another where at least one language is a low-resource languages, i.e. training data for this language is scarce.

children.name: Multimodal Machine Translation
description: Translating text from one language to another using based on a combination of multimodal inputs, e.g. text combined with an image.

children.name: Face to Face Translation
description: Translating a video of a person speaking from one language into another language.

children.name: Clinical Language Translation
description: Translating clinical texts to layperson-understandable language.

children.name: Legal Document Translation
description: Translating legal documents to another language.

children.name: Zero-Shot Machine Translation
description: Translate text or speech from one language to another without supervision.

children.name: ACCURAT balanced test corpus for under resourced languages Russian-Estonian - Machine Translation benchmarking

children.name: ACCURAT balanced test corpus for under resourced languages Estonian-Russian - Machine Translation benchmarking

children.name: Text Generation
refactor_comment: Rename or merge with 'Natural language generation'?

children.name: Dialog Generation
description: Given an input dialog statement, generate an appropriate response.

children.name: Data-to-Text Generation
description: Generating natural language text from non-linguistic input, such as databases, spreadsheets or knowledge bases.

children.name: Visual Storytelling
description: Generating stories from a sequence of images.

children.name: Cleaned E2E NLG Challenge - Data-to-Text Generation benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Cleaned E2E NLG Challenge - Data-to-Text Generation benchmarking

children.name: E2E NLG Challenge - Data-to-Text Generation benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: E2E NLG Challenge - Data-to-Text Generation benchmarking

children.name: Text Style Transfer
description: Transform an input text such that the value of a particular linguistic attribute of interest (e.g. language = English, sentiment = Positive) is transferred to a different desired value (e.g. language = French, sentiment = Negative). (Source: Adapted from https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.09395)

children.name: Word Attribute Transfer
description: Changing a word's attribute, such as its gender.

children.name: Paraphrase Generation
description: Given an input text, such as a sentence, generate a paraphrase of that text, i.e. a different text with the same meaning.

children.name: Table-to-Text Generation
description: Given information in tabular format, generate a description of the table content in natural language.

children.name: KB-to-Language Generation
description: Given information from a knowledge base, generate a description of this information in natural language.

children.name: Wikipedia Person and Animal Dataset - KB-to-Language Generation benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Wikipedia Person and Animal Dataset - KB-to-Language Generation benchmarking

children.name: Wikipedia Person and Animal Dataset - Table-to-Text Generation benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Wikipedia Person and Animal Dataset - Table-to-Text Generation benchmarking

children.name: Paper generation
description: Generating scientific paper texts, such as abstracts.

children.name: ACL Title and Abstract Dataset - Paper generation benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: ACL Title and Abstract Dataset - Paper generation benchmarking

children.name: Text Infilling
description: Predicting missing spans of text which are consistent with the preceding and subsequent text. (Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.05339)

children.name: Concept-To-Text Generation
description: Generating natural language text from a conceptualized representation, such as an ontology.

children.name: News Generation
description: Generating news texts.

children.name: Sonnet Generation
description: Generating a poetry in the form of a sonnet.

children.name: Story Completion
description: Given a story prefix and two possible endings, determining which one is the correct (coherent) ending of the story.

children.name: Automatic Writing
description: Generating text based on internal machine representations.

children.name: Yahoo Questions - Text Generation benchmarking
refactor_comment: Not clear what kind of dataset this is

children.name: Task-Oriented Dialog Systems
description: Achieving a pre-defined task through a dialog.

children.name: Goal-Oriented Dialog
description: Achieving a pre-defined goal through a dialog.

children.name: Short-Text Conversation
description: Given a short text, finding an appropriate response (Source: http://staff.ustc.edu.cn/~cheneh/paper_pdf/2013/HaoWang.pdf)

children.name: Goal-Oriented Dialog Systems
description: Achieving a pre-defined goal through a dialog.

children.name: Text-To-Speech Synthesis
description: Converting written text in natural language to speech.

children.name: Prosody Prediction
description: Predicting prosodic prominence from text.

children.name: Helsinki Prosody Corpus - Prosody Prediction benchmarking
description: Predicting prosodic prominence from text. This is a 2-way classification task, assigning each word in a sentence a label 1 (prominent) or 0 (non-prominent).
papers_with_code_id: Helsinki Prosody Corpus - Prosody Prediction benchmarking

children.name: Text Simplification
description: Text simplification is an operation used in natural language processing to modify, enhance, classify or otherwise process an existing corpus of human-readable text in such a way that the grammar and structure of the prose is greatly simplified, while the underlying meaning and information remains the same (Source: Wikipedia)

children.name: Clinical Language Translation
description: Translating clinical texts to layperson-understandable language.

children.name: Lexical Simplification
description: Reducing text complexity by substituting words.

children.name: Question Answering
description: Building systems that automatically answer questions posed in a natural language (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Open-Domain Question Answering
description: Finding the answer to a question from a large collection of documents (https://arxiv.org/abs/2006.05244)
refactor_comment: Is there a more precise definition?

children.name: Answer Selection
description: Given a question, identifying which answer of a set of candidate answers is correct.

children.name: Ubuntu Dialogue (v1, Ranking) - Answer Selection benchmarking

children.name: Ubuntu Dialogue (v2, Ranking) - Answer Selection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Ubuntu Dialogue (v2, Ranking) - Answer Selection benchmarking

children.name: Community Question Answering
description: Building systems that automatically answers to questions posed in a natural language on a Q&A platform, such as Stack Overflow or Quora (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia and nlpprogress.com).

children.name: CrowdSource QA - Community Question Answering benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CrowdSource QA - Community Question Answering benchmarking

children.name: Knowledge Base Question Answering
description: Given a natural language question, find a set of entities in a knowledge base that constitutes the answer (Source: https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/C18-1280.pdf)
refactor_comment: Add 'Knowledge base process' as parent class?

description: Building systems that automatically answer mathematical questions.

children.name: Memex Question Answering
description: Given a collection of photos or videos from a user, to automatically answer questions that help users recover their memory about events captured in the collection (Source: Adapted from https://arxiv.org/abs/1708.01336)

description: Given a sequence of words, predicting the next most probable word based on statistical and probabilistic modeling.

description: Image captioning is the automatic generation of natural language descriptions of the content of an input image.

description: Automatic generation of detailed, multi-sentence natural language descriptions of the content of an input image.

children.name: Text Summarization
description: Shortening a set of data computationally, to create a summary that represents the most important or relevant information within the original content (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Sentence Summarization
description: Generating a summary of a given sentence.

children.name: Sentence Compression
description: Producing a shorter sentence by removing redundant information, preserving the grammatically and the important content of the original sentence. (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Unsupervised Sentence Compression
description: Producing a shorter sentence by removing redundant information, preserving the grammatically and the important content of the original sentence without supervision. (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Abstractive Sentence Summarization
description: Generating a summary of a given sentence by condensing and paraphrasing the sentence.

children.name: Unsupervised Sentence Summarization
description: Generating a summary of a given sentence without supervision.

children.name: Cross-Language Text Summarization
description: Using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve summarization tasks in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Abstractive Text Summarization
description: Generating a summary of a text by condensing and paraphrasing the text.

children.name: Timeline Summarization
description: Identifying key dates of major events and providing short descriptions of what happened on these dates. (Source: https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/D19-5403/)

children.name: Reader-Aware Summarization
description: Using reader comments to improve summarization performance.

children.name: CNN / Daily Mail - Abstractive Text Summarization benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CNN / Daily Mail - Abstractive Text Summarization benchmarking

children.name: Extractive Document Summarization
description: Given a document, selecting a subset of the words or sentences which best represents a summary of the document.

children.name: Reader-Aware Summarization
description: Using reader comments to improve summarization performance.

children.name: CNN / Daily Mail - Extractive Document Summarization benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CNN / Daily Mail - Extractive Document Summarization benchmarking

children.name: Document Summarization
description: Shortening a document computationally, to create a summary that represents the most important or relevant information within the original content (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: CNN / Daily Mail - Document Summarization benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CNN / Daily Mail - Document Summarization benchmarking

children.name: Multi-Document Summarization
description: Extracting information from multiple texts written about the same topic.

children.name: Query-Based Extractive Summarization
description: Extracting summarized information that answers a given query based on a reference text.

children.name: Meeting Summarization
description: Generating a summary from meeting transcriptions.

children.name: Text Augmentation
description: Based on available training data, generating additional, synthetic data.

children.name: Question Generation
description: Generating a valid and fluent question given a text passage and the target answer. (Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.03401)

children.name: COCO Visual Question Answering (VQA) real images 1.0 open ended - Question Generation benchmarking

papers_with_code_id: Visual Question Generation - Question Generation benchmarking

children.name: Conversational Response Generation
description: Given an input conversation, generate a natural-looking text reply to the last conversation element.

children.name: Graph-to-Sequence
description: Mapping an input graph to a sequence of vectors.
refactor_comment: Is this really Natural language processing?

children.name: Text Attribute Transfer
description: Transform an input text such that the value of a particular linguistic attribute of interest (e.g. language = English, sentiment = Positive) is transferred to a different desired value (e.g. language = French, sentiment = Negative). (Source: Adapted from https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.09395)
refactor_comment: Depending on the attributes, might also fit into 'Machine translation'

children.name: Natural language understanding
description: Natural language understanding refers to tasks that focus on automated reasoning and inference.
refactor_comment: Class has overlaps with 'Semantic analysis' and 'Pragmatic analysis' classes.

children.name: Reading Comprehension
description: Given a text and a question, finding the text span that contains the answer to the question.
refactor_comment: Should perhaps be a subclass of Question answering since most of the time no real 'reasoning' is involved.

children.name: Relational Reasoning
description: Identifying the relationship among different entities.

children.name: Natural Language Inference
description: Given a premise, determining whether a hypothesis is true (entailment), false (contradiction), or undetermined (neutral) (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Cross-Lingual Natural Language Inference
description: Using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve a natural language inference task in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: MultiNLI Dev - Natural Language Inference benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: MultiNLI Dev - Natural Language Inference benchmarking

children.name: Table-based Fact Verification
description: Verifying facts given semi-structured data.

children.name: Abstract Argumentation
description: Identifying argumentative statements from natural language dialogs.

children.name: Natural Language Transduction
description: Converting one sequence into another

children.name: Natural language analysis
description: Natural language analysis refers to the tasks of determining the lexical, morphological, syntactical, semantical properties of words, sentences, texts or copora and to the retrieval or extraction of information from these sources.

children.name: Information Extraction
description: Information extraction is the task of automatically extracting structured information from unstructured and / or semi-structured machine-readable documents and other electronically represented sources (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Named-entity and concept recognition
description: Recognise named entities, ontology concepts, tags, events, and dictionary terms within documents.

children.name: Relation Extraction
description: Relation extraction is the task of detecting and classifying semantic relationships from text.

children.name: Relation Classification
description: Relation extraction is the task of classifying semantic relationships from text.

children.name: Implicit Discourse Relation Classification
description: Parsing a text into a set of discourse relations between two adjacent or non-adjacent discourse units in the absence of explicit connectives, such as 'but' or 'however', and classifying those relations. (Source: Adapted from https://www.cs.brandeis.edu/~clp/conll15st/intro.html)

children.name: Few-Shot Relation Classification
description: Relation classification with minimum annotated data.

children.name: Relationship extraction using distant supervision
description: Relation extraction using distant supervision refers to detecting and classifying semantic relationships from text by using an already existing knowledge base that contains examples of the types of relations to be extracted.

children.name: New York Times Corpus - Relationship Extraction (Distant Supervised) benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: New York Times Corpus - Relationship Extraction (Distant Supervised) benchmarking

children.name: Relation Mention Extraction
description: Extracting phrases representative for a specific relation.

children.name: Joint Entity and Relation Extraction
description: Joint entity and relation extraction refers to the combined task of identifying entities and extracting relations from a given text.

children.name: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking

children.name: Biomedical Relation Extraction
description: Biomedical relation extraction is the task of detecting and classifying semantic relationships from biomedical text.

children.name: Open Information Extraction
description: In natural language processing, open information extraction is the task of generating a structured, machine-readable representation of the information in text, usually in the form of triples or n-ary propositions (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Joint Entity and Relation Extraction
description: Joint entity and relation extraction refers to the combined task of identifying entities and extracting relations from a given text.

children.name: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking

children.name: Entity Extraction
description: Entity extraction is the task of finding and classifying mentions of entities based on pre-defined categories (e.g., names, places) in a given text.

children.name: Joint Entity and Relation Extraction
description: Joint entity and relation extraction refers to the combined task of identifying entities and extracting relations from a given text.

children.name: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: SciERC - Joint Entity and Relation Extraction benchmarking

children.name: Temporal Information Extraction
description: Temporal information extraction is the task of identifying events and temporal expressions in a given text, extracting the temporal relations between those events and constructing a timeline from these relations (Source: Adapted from https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.09401)

children.name: Low Resource Named Entity Recognition
description: Low resource named entity recognition is the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve named entity recognition tasks in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Uyghur Unsequestered Set - Low Resource Named Entity Recognition benchmarking

children.name: Language Identification
description: Language identification is the task of determining the language of a text.

children.name: Native Language Identification
description: Native-language identification is the task of determining an author's native language based only on their writings in a second language (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Named Entity Recognition
description: Named entity recognition is a subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities mentioned in unstructured text into pre-defined categories such as person names, organizations, locations, medical codes, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc. (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Nested Named Entity Recognition
description: Nested named entity recognition is a subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify nested named entities (i.e., hierarchically structured entities) mentioned in unstructured text (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: GENIA - Nested Named Entity Recognition benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: GENIA - Nested Named Entity Recognition benchmarking

children.name: ACE 2004 - Nested Named Entity Recognition benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: ACE 2004 - Nested Named Entity Recognition benchmarking

children.name: Chinese Named Entity Recognition
description: Chinese named entity recognition is a subtask of information extraction that seeks to locate and classify named entities mentioned in unstructured text into pre-defined categories such as person names, organizations, locations, medical codes, time expressions, quantities, monetary values, percentages, etc. from Chinese text (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Scientific Concept Extraction
description: Scientific concept extraction is the task of extracting concepts that best reflect the content of a scientific text.

children.name: Overlapping Mention Recognition
description: Overlapping mention recognition is the task of correctly identifying all mentions of an entity in the presence of overlapping entity mentions.

children.name: Nested Mention Recognition
description: Nested mention recognition is the task of correctly modeling the nested structure of mentions.

children.name: Joint Named Entity Recognition and Classification
description: Joint named entity recognition and classification refers to the combined task of identifying named entitites in a given text and text classification.

children.name: Keyword Extraction
description: Keyword extraction is tasked with the automatic identification of terms that best describe the subject of a document (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Authorship attribution
description: Authorship attribution is the task of determining the author of a text.

children.name: Scientific Results Extraction
description: Scientific results extraction is the task of extracting relevant result information (e.g., in the case of Machine learning performance results: task, dataset, metric name, metric value) from the scientific literature.

children.name: NLP-TDMS (Exp, arXiv only) - Scientific Results Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: NLP-TDMS (Exp, arXiv only) - Scientific Results Extraction benchmarking

children.name: PWC Leaderboards (restricted) - Scientific Results Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: PWC Leaderboards (restricted) - Scientific Results Extraction benchmarking

children.name: Syntactic analysis
description: Syntactic analysis is the process of analyzing a string of symbols, either in natural language, computer languages or data structures, conforming to the rules of a formal grammar.

children.name: Part-Of-Speech Tagging
description: Marking up a word in a text (corpus) as corresponding to a particular part of speech based on both its definition and its context (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Unsupervised Part-Of-Speech Tagging
description: Marking up a word in a text (corpus) as corresponding to a particular part of speech based on both its definition and its context by using an untagged corpus for training and producing the tagset by induction (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Grammar checking
description: Verify text for grammatical correctness.

children.name: Grammatical Error Correction
description: Correct grammatical errors in text.

children.name: CoNLL-2014 Shared Task - Grammatical Error Correction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CoNLL-2014 Shared Task - Grammatical Error Correction benchmarking

children.name: Grammatical Error Detection
refactor_comment: Perhaps this should be the superclass of "Grammatical Error Correction", rather than the subclass

children.name: CoNLL-2014 A2 - Grammatical Error Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CoNLL-2014 A2 - Grammatical Error Detection benchmarking

children.name: CoNLL-2014 A1 - Grammatical Error Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CoNLL-2014 A1 - Grammatical Error Detection benchmarking

children.name: Linguistic Acceptability Assessment
description: Assess whether a sentence is grammatical or ungrammatical.

children.name: Dependency Parsing
description: Extract a dependency parse tree from a sentence that represents its syntactic structure according to a dependency grammar.

children.name: Dependency Grammar Induction
description: Inducing a dependency-based grammar.

children.name: Chunking
description: Identifying parts of speech and short phrases, such as noun phrases.

children.name: Constituency Parsing
description: Extract a constituency-based parse tree from a sentence that represents its syntactic structure according to a phrase structure grammar. (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Constituency Grammar Induction
description: Inducing a constituency-based phrase structure grammar.

children.name: Anaphora Resolution
description: Resolving what expression a pronoun or a noun phrase refers to.

children.name: The ARRAU Corpus - Abstract Anaphora Resolution benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: The ARRAU Corpus - Abstract Anaphora Resolution benchmarking

children.name: Query Wellformedness
description: Assessing whether a query is grammatically correct, contains no spelling mistakes, and asks an explicit question.

children.name: Tokenization
description: Splitting a string into parts, i.e., tokens.

children.name: Combinatory Categorical Grammar (CCG) Supertagging
description: Tagging a sentence based on a combinatory categorial grammar.

children.name: CCGBank - Combinatory Categorical Grammar (CCG) Supertagging benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: CCGBank - Combinatory Categorical Grammar (CCG) Supertagging benchmarking

children.name: Arabic Text Diacritization
description: Given a partially or non-diacritized Arabic text, find the correct diacritization for it (Source:https://arxiv.org/pdf/1905.01965.pdf)

children.name: Semantic analysis
description: Relating syntactic structures, from the levels of phrases, clauses, sentences and paragraphs to the level of the writing as a whole, to their language-independent meanings (Source: Wikipedia)
refactor_comment: According to Wikipedia same as 'Semantic parsing' but used differently in Machine learning context.

Apparently, 'semantic analysis' has a different meaning in the context of linguistics as compared to Machine Learning:  See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semantic_analysis_(linguistics) and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semantic_analysis_(machine_learning)

children.name: Dialog State Tracking
description: Determining at each turn of a dialog the full representation of what the user wants at that point in the dialog, which contains a goal constraint, a set of requested slots, and the user's dialogue act (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Second dialogue state tracking challenge - Dialog State Tracking benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Second dialogue state tracking challenge - Dialog State Tracking benchmarking

children.name: Dialog Interpretation
description: Interpreting the meaning of a dialog.

children.name: Dialog Act Classification
description: Classifying an utterance with respect to the function it serves in a dialog, i.e. the act the speaker is performing (Source nlpprogress.com).

children.name: ICSI Meeting Recorder Dialog Act (MRDA) corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: ICSI Meeting Recorder Dialog Act (MRDA) corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking

children.name: Switchboard corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Switchboard corpus - Dialog Act Classification benchmarking

children.name: Hypernym Discovery
description: Finding hypernyms for a given word or phrase.

children.name: Data Mining
description: Data mining is a process of discovering patterns in large data sets involving methods at the intersection of machine learning, statistics, and database systems (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Opinion Mining
description: Identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral (Source: Oxford Languages)

children.name: Argument Mining
description: Automatic extraction and identification of argumentative structures from natural language text (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Sequential Pattern Mining
description: Sequential pattern mining is a topic of data mining concerned with finding statistically relevant patterns between data examples where the values are delivered in a sequence (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Parallel Corpus Mining
description: Mining a corpus of bilingual sentence pairs that are translations of each other.

children.name: Opinion Mining
description: Identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral (Source: Oxford Languages)

children.name: Argument Mining
description: Automatic extraction and identification of argumentative structures from natural language text (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Sequential Pattern Mining
description: Sequential pattern mining is a topic of data mining concerned with finding statistically relevant patterns between data examples where the values are delivered in a sequence (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Parallel Corpus Mining
description: Mining a corpus of bilingual sentence pairs that are translations of each other.

children.name: Question Quality Assessment
description: Checking whether a question is of high quality according to certain pre-defined criteria.

children.name: Word Sense Disambiguation
description: Identifying which sense of a word is used in a sentence.

description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Word-sense_induction
Identifiying the senses of a word (i.e. meanings). (Source: Wikipedia)

children.name: Sentence Pair Modeling
description: Comparing two sentences and their relationship based on their internal representation.

children.name: Semantic Role Labeling
description: Assigning labels to words or phrases in a sentence that indicate their semantic role in the sentence, such as that of an agent, goal, or result (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Predicate Detection
description: Detecting predicates in sentences.

children.name: Semantic Role Labeling (predicted predicates)
description: Detecting predicates in sentences.

children.name: Textual Analogy Parsing
description: Identifying factual statements in a text and the higher-order relations between them, e.g., comparisons of facts related to entities. (Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/1809.02700)

children.name: Semantic Textual Similarity
description: Determining how similar two texts are in their meaning.

children.name: Question Similarity
description: Determining how similar two questions are in their meaning.

children.name: Medical question pair similarity computation
description: Predicting whether to questions on medical topics have the same meaning.

children.name: Semantic Composition
description: Understanding the meaning of text by composing the meanings of the individual words in the text (Source: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1405.7908.pdf)

children.name: Semantic Parsing
description: Converting a natural language utterance to a logical form: a machine-understandable representation of its meaning (Source: Wikipedia)

children.name: Semantic Dependency Parsing
description: Identify semantic relationships between words in a text using a graph representation.

children.name: Complex Word Identification
description: Identifying difficult words or expressions in a text.

children.name: Entity Alignment
description: Entity Alignment is the task of finding entities that refer to the same real-world object.
refactor_comment: Might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base process'

children.name: Entity Linking
description: Assigning a unique identity to entities (such as famous individuals, locations, or companies) mentioned in text (Source: Wikipedia).
refactor_comment: Might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base process'
Same as 'Entity disambiguation' according to Wikipedia?

children.name: Cross-Lingual Entity Linking
description: Cross-lingual entity linking is the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve entity linking tasks (i.e., assigning a unique identity to entities in a text) in another, commonly low-resource, language.

children.name: News Annotation
description: Assigning the appropriate labels to a news text based on a set of pre-defined labels.

children.name: Text Clustering
description: Grouping a set of texts in such a way that objects in the same group (called a cluster) are more similar (in some sense) to each other than to those in other groups (clusters). (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia)

children.name: Text Classification
description: Assign a text to one ore more classes or categories.

children.name: Multi-Label Text Classification
description: Assigning the appropriate labels to a text based on a set of pre-defined labels.

children.name: Multi-Label Classification Of Biomedical Texts
description: Assigning the appropriate labels to a biomedical text based on a set of pre-defined labels.
Biomedical multi-label text classification.

children.name: Kan-Shan Cup - Multi-Label Text Classification benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Kan-Shan Cup - Multi-Label Text Classification benchmarking

children.name: Document Classification
description: Assign a document to one ore more classes or categories.

children.name: Emotion Classification
description: Identify the emotion, e.g., happiness, anger or surprise, conveyed by an input text.

children.name: Text Categorization
description: Assign a sentence to a class or category.

children.name: Citation Intent Classification
description: Identifying the reason why an author cited another author.

children.name: Cross-Domain Text Classification
description: Learning an accurate model for the new unlabeled target domain given labeled data from multiple source domains where all domains have (possibly) different label sets. (Source: https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P16-1155.pdf)

children.name: Cross-Lingual Document Classification
description: Cross-lingual document classification refers to the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve classification tasks in another, commonly low-resource, language.

children.name: Entity Resolution
description: Finding records in a data set that refer to the same entity across different data sources (e.g., data files, books, websites, and databases). (Source: Wikipedia)
refactor_comment: Might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base process'

children.name: Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) Parsing
description: Representing the semantic meaning of text in a graph where nodes represent concepts and directed edges represent relations between those concepts.

children.name: Topic modeling
description: Discovering the abstract "topics" that occur in a collection of documents based on statistical modeling.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Bitext Mining
description: Cross-lingual bitext mining is the task of mining sentence pairs that are translations of each other from large text corpora.

children.name: Text Matching
description: Matching a target text to a source text based on their meaning.

children.name: Entity Typing
refactor_comment: Might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base process'

children.name: Entity Disambiguation
description: Assigning a unique identity to entities (such as famous individuals, locations, or companies) mentioned in text (Source: Wikipedia).
refactor_comment: Might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base process'
Same as 'Entity linking' according to Wikipedia?

children.name: Lexical semantics
description: Lexical semantics looks at how the meaning of the lexical units correlates with the structure of the language or syntax.

children.name: Morphological Analysis
description: Morphological analysis is the process of determining the morphemes from which a given word is constructed.

children.name: Spelling Correction
description: Correcting wrong spellings of words.

children.name: Lexical Normalization
description: Lexical normalization is the task of transforming non-canonical words into canonical ones.

children.name: Morphological Tagging
description: Morphological tagging is the task of assigning labels to a sequence of tokens that describe them morphologically. As compared to Part-of-speech tagging, morphological tagging also considers morphological features, such as case, gender or the tense of verbs.

children.name: Morphological Inflection
description: Morphological Inflection is the task of generating a target (inflected form) word from a source word (base form), given a morphological attribute, e.g. number, tense or person (Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/1810.10802)

children.name: Lemmatization
description: Lemmatization is the process of grouping together the inflected forms of a word so they can be analysed as a single item, identified by the word's lemma, or dictionary form.

children.name: Multi-word expression sememe prediction
description: Multi-word expression sememe prediction is the task of identifying the minimum semantic units for a given multi-word expression.

children.name: Stemming
description: Stemming is the process of reducing inflected (or sometimes derived) words to their word stem, base or root form (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Pragmatics analysis
description: Pragmatics analysis is the task of analyzing the meaning of a text beyond its literal meaning considering its context.

children.name: Sentiment Analysis
description: Sentiment analysis is the process of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral (Source: Oxford Languages)

children.name: Arabic Sentiment Analysis
description: Arabic sentiment analysis is the process of computationally identifying and categorizing opinions expressed in a piece of arabic text, especially in order to determine whether the writer's attitude towards a particular topic, product, etc. is positive, negative, or neutral (Source: Oxford Languages)

children.name: Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis
description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis is the task of identifying sentiments related to different aspects, e.g. attributes, characteristics, or features of a product or service.

children.name: Aspect Extraction
description: Aspect extraction is the task of identifying and extracting terms relevant for opinion mining and sentiment analysis, for example terms for product attributes or features.

children.name: SemEval 2014 Task 4 Sub Task 2 - Aspect Extraction benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: SemEval 2014 Task 4 Sub Task 2 - Aspect Extraction benchmarking

children.name: SemEval 2015 Task 12 - Extract aspect-polarity tuple benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: SemEval 2015 Task 12 - Extract aspect-polarity tuple benchmarking

children.name: Extract Aspect
description: Aspect extraction is the task of identifying and extracting terms relevant for opinion mining and sentiment analysis, for example terms for product attributes or features.

papers_with_code_id: SemEval 2014 Task 4 Sub Task 2 - Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis benchmarking

children.name: Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
description: Multimodal sentiment analysis is a new dimension of the traditional text-based sentiment analysis, which goes beyond the analysis of texts, and includes other modalities such as audio and visual data (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Fine-Grained Opinion Analysis
description: Fine-grained opinion analysis refers to the task of (1) detecting opinion expressions that convey attitudes such as sentiments, agreements, beliefs, or intentions, (2) measuring their intensity, (3) identifying their holders i.e. entities that express an attitude, (4) identifying their targets i.e. entities or propositions at which the attitude is directed, and (5) classifying their target-dependent attitude. (Source: Adapted from https://arxiv.org/pdf/1711.00768.pdf)

children.name: Bias Detection
description: Bias detection is the task of detecting and measuring racism, sexism and otherwise discriminatory behavior in a model (Source: https://stereoset.mit.edu/)
refactor_comment: Rename since it refers to language models but not to text itself?

children.name: Abuse Detection
description: Abuse detection is the task of identifying abusive behaviors, such as hate speech, offensive language, sexism and racism, in utterances from social media platforms (Source: https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.00385).

children.name: Clickbait Detection
description: Clickbait detection is the task of identifying clickbait, a form of false advertisement, that uses hyperlink text or a thumbnail link that is designed to attract attention and to entice users to follow that link and read, view, or listen to the linked piece of online content, with a defining characteristic of being deceptive, typically sensationalized or misleading (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia)

children.name: Negation Detection
description: Negation detection is the task of identifying negation cues in text.

children.name: SFU Review Corpus - Negation Scope Resolution benchmarking

papers_with_code_id: BioScope : Full Papers - Negation Scope Resolution benchmarking

children.name: Stance Detection
description: Extracting a subject's reaction to a claim made by a primary actor (Source: nlpprogress.com)

children.name: Emotion Recognition
description: Emotion recognition is the process of identifying human emotion from text, audio, image or video (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Expressive hands and faces dataset (EHF). - Multimodal Emotion Recognition benchmarking

papers_with_code_id: EC - Emotion Recognition in Conversation benchmarking

children.name: Intent Classification
description: Intent classification is the task of classifying a users' intent based on input in natural language  and a collection of pre-defined intents.

children.name: Slot Filling
description: Slot filling is the task of extracting the values of certain types of attributes, i.e. slots, for a given entity from a large collection of source documents (Source: Adapted from https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/D17-1274/)
refactor_comment: According to Wikipedia the same as 'Semantic role labeling' but used differently in the literature?

children.name: ASOS.com user intent - Intent Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: ASOS.com user intent - Intent Detection benchmarking

children.name: Fake News Detection
description: Fake news detection is the task of detecting forms of news consisting of deliberate disinformation or hoaxes spread via traditional news media (print and broadcast) or online social media (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Sarcasm Detection
description: Sarcasm detection is the task of identifying cutting, often ironic remarks intended to express contempt or ridicule, in text (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia)

children.name: Hate speech detection
description: Hate speech detection is the task of detecting speech that expresses hate or encourages violence towards a person or group based on something such as race, religion, sex, or sexual orientation (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Automatic Misogynistic Identification - Hate Speech Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Automatic Misogynistic Identification - Hate Speech Detection benchmarking

children.name: Subjectivity Analysis
description: Labeling a statement as either subjective or objective.

children.name: Coreference Resolution
description: Coreference resolution is the task of determining expressions that refer to the same entity in a given text.

children.name: Event detection
description: Detection of real-life events based on a collection of documents.

children.name: Twitter Event Detection
description: Detection of real-life events, such as protests, based on tweets.

children.name: Action Parsing
description: Action parsing is the task of, given a video or still image, assigning each frame or image a label describing the action in that frame or image.
refactor_comment: Really NLP and not vision process?

children.name: Rumor Detection
description: Rumor detection is the task of identifying rumors, i.e. statements whose veracity is not quickly or ever confirmed, in utterances on social media platforms.

children.name: Paraphrase Identification
description: Paraphrase identificiation is the task of determining whether two text passages have the same meaning.

children.name: Quora Question Pairs - Paraphrase Identification benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Quora Question Pairs - Paraphrase Identification benchmarking

children.name: Counter-speech Detection
description: Counter-speech detection is the task of detecting counter-speech, i.e., a crowd-sourced response that argues, disagrees, or presents an opposing view to extremism or hateful content on social media platforms (Source: Adapted from: https://icsr.info/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/ICSR-Report-Challenging-Hate-Counter-speech-Practices-in-Europe.pdf)

children.name: Youtube counterspeech dataset - Counterspeech Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: Youtube counterspeech dataset - Counterspeech Detection benchmarking

children.name: Language Acquisition
description: Language acquisition refers to tasks related to the learning of a second language.

children.name: Humor Detection
description: Humor detection is the task of identifying comical or amusing elements.

children.name: 200k Short Texts for Humor Detection - Humor Detection benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: 200k Short Texts for Humor Detection - Humor Detection benchmarking

children.name: Incongruity Detection
description: Incongruity detection is the task of identifying statements in a text that are inconsistent with each other.

children.name: Speculation Detection
description: Identifying information in text that is speculative as opposed to factual information.

children.name: Speculation Scope Resolution
description: Identifiy the scope of a speculation cue that indicates uncertainty in a given text.

children.name: BioScope : Full Papers - Speculation Scope Resolution benchmarking

children.name: BioScope : Abstracts - Speculation Scope Resolution benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: BioScope : Abstracts - Speculation Scope Resolution benchmarking

children.name: Sentence Ordering
description: Sentence ordering is the task of determining the correct order of a collection of sentences from a continuous text whose order has been mixed-up.

children.name: Automated Essay Scoring
description: Automated essay scoring is the use of specialized computer programs to assign grades to essays written in an educational setting (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Automated Writing Evaluation
description: Automated writing evaluation refers to the task of analysing and measuring written text based on features, such as syntax, text complexity and vocabulary range.

children.name: Paraphrase detection
description: Paraphrase detection is the task of determining whether two text passages have the same meaning.

children.name: Information Retrieval
description: Information retrieval is the activity of obtaining information system resources that are relevant to an information need from a collection of those resources (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Ad-Hoc Information Retrieval
description: Ad-hoc information retrieval refers to the task of returning information resources related to a user query formulated in natural language.

children.name: TREC Robust04 - Ad-Hoc Information Retrieval benchmarking
papers_with_code_id: TREC Robust04 - Ad-Hoc Information Retrieval benchmarking

children.name: Passage Re-Ranking
description: Passage re-ranking is the task of scoring and re-ranking a collection of retrieved documents based on an input query.

children.name: Document Ranking
description: Sort documents according to some criterion so that the "best" results appear early in the result list displayed to the user (Source: Wikipedia).

children.name: Conversational Response Selection
description: Conversational response selection refers to the task of identifying the most relevant response to a given input sentence from a collection of sentences.

children.name: Ubuntu Dialogue (v1, Ranking) - Conversational Response Selection benchmarking

children.name: Web analytics
description: Measuring, collecting, analysing and reporting of web data for purposes of understanding and optimizing web usage.

children.name: Web Page Tagging
description: Assigning appropriate tags to a web page.

children.name: Lexical Analysis
description: Lexical analysis is the process of converting a sequence of characters into a sequence of tokens (strings with an assigned and thus identified meaning). (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia)

children.name: Biomedical Natural Language Processing
description: Biomedical natural language processing is the task of processing text related to the biomedical domain (e.g., scientific literature, electronic health records).

children.name: Biomedical Relation Extraction
description: Biomedical relation extraction is the task of detecting and classifying semantic relationships from biomedical text.

children.name: Multi-Label Classification Of Biomedical Texts
description: Assigning the appropriate labels to a biomedical text based on a set of pre-defined labels.
Biomedical multi-label text classification.

children.name: Medical question pair similarity computation
description: Predicting whether to questions on medical topics have the same meaning.
comment: Uses a subset of medical questions from the 'Quora Question Pairs' dataset.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Natural Language Processing
description: Cross-lingual natural language processing is the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve tasks in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Natural Language Inference
description: Using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve a natural language inference task in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Transfer
description: Cross-lingual transfer refers to transfer learning using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve tasks in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Document Classification
description: Cross-lingual document classification refers to the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve classification tasks in another, commonly low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Entity Linking
description: Cross-lingual entity linking is the task of using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve entity linking tasks (i.e., assigning a unique identity to entities in a text) in another, commonly low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Language Text Summarization
description: Using data and models available for one language for which ample such resources are available (e.g., English) to solve summarization tasks in another, commonly more low-resource, language.

children.name: Cross-Lingual Bitext Mining
description: Cross-lingual bitext mining is the task of mining sentence pairs that are translations of each other from large text corpora.

children.name: Text Effects Transfer
description: Text effects transfer refers to the task of transferring typography styles (e.g., color, texture) to an input image of a text element.
refactor_comment: This seems to be 'typography' and not natural language processing in the classic sense. 'Artistic process'?

children.name: Text embedding
description: Text embedding is the collective name for a set of language modeling and feature learning techniques in natural language processing  where words or phrases from the vocabulary are mapped to vectors of real numbers (Source: Adapted from Wikipedia).

children.name: Phrase Vector Embedding
description: Mapping a phrase to a vector of real numbers

children.name: multi-word expression embedding
description: Mapping a muli-word expression to a vector of real numbers

children.name: Knowledge Base Population
description: Knowledge base population is the task of filling the incomplete elements of a given knowledge base by automatically processing a large corpus of text.
refactor_comment: Depending on the definition, might also fit into the class 'Knowledge base completion" under 'Knowledge base process'

children.name: Reinforcement Learning
description: Reinforcement learning is a subfield of Machine learning and refers to algorithms that incrementally learn the best sequence of actions to achieve an objective by rewarding actions considered relevant to achieve the objective and penalizing actions considered irrelevant or unhelpful to attain the objective.
refactor_comment: Should this be a subclass of 'Natural language processing'?
